meanings.definition: To release from being attached or connected.
meanings.sent1: She was unhitching the trailer from the car.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was unhitching the plow from the tractor.
meanings.sent3: After unhitching the leash, the dog ran freely in the park.
meanings.sent4: Unhitching the boat from the dock felt like setting sail on a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick by unhitching the chains in seconds.

meanings.definition: The act of disconnecting or separating.
meanings.sent1: The unhitching of the train cars was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: He observed the unhitching of the cables with interest.
meanings.sent3: The unhitching of the two best friends caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: The unhitching of the old memories brought a sense of relief.
meanings.sent5: The unhitching of the planets from their orbits was a fascinating concept.
